great quality. Great use of lighting and some neat effects. The story kinda drifts around though and sometimes just gets ridiculous.
I can' believe someone actually made a movie based on the myth that you only use 20% of your brain when you really use 100% already. Apart from that though, it's not bad.

video & audio: 10/10
movie: 7/10

The movie is based on a book, something a surprising number of people failed to grasp despite it being displayed throughout the actual movie (at least in the theatrical release, which I went to see). 

Suspending your disbelief for the period of the movie, it is an entertaining ride. However, I will say the book is much better and there are many details the movie 'glosses' over for the sake of keeping the movie at a reasonable time. The book explains things in greater detail, too. You'll have to take certain details missing in stride, though. For example, Eddie doesn't start out with a girlfriend. And the initial bit of the story, like his relationship with his ex-wife, are much different a dynamic.

iirc, that bullshit myth is 10%. I moved from knowing its existence to knowing the bullshitness in short order tho, and it was like 15 years ago.

how there can be so many people still believe in and repopularizing that shit today is beyond me.
